question:
A company runs its applications on both Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (Amazon EKS) clusters and on-premises Kubernetes clusters. The company wants to view all clusters and workloads from a central location.

Which solution will meet these requirements with the LEAST operational overhead?

options.A: Use Amazon CloudWatch Container Insights to collect and group the cluster information.
options.B: Use Amazon EKS Connector to register and connect all Kubernetes clusters.
options.C: Use AWS Systems Manager to collect and view the cluster information.
options.D: Use Amazon EKS Anywhere as the primary cluster to view the other clusters with native Kubernetes commands.

explanation: Amazon EKS Connector allows you to register and connect any Kubernetes cluster (including on-premises) to AWS and view them in the Amazon EKS console. This provides a unified view with minimal operational overhead.
